The macro {{tt|NULL}} is an implementation-defined [[cpp/language/pointer#Null pointers|null pointer constant]].

===Possible implementation===
{{eq fun|
#define NULL 0
// since C++11
#define NULL nullptr
}}

===Notes===
In C, the macro {{tt|NULL}} may have the type {{c/core|void*}}, but that is not allowed in C++ because null pointer constants cannot have that type.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;cstddef&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;type_traits&gt;
#include &lt;typeinfo&gt;

class S;

int main()
{
    int* p = NULL;
    int* p2 = static_cast&lt;std::nullptr_t&gt;(NULL);
    void(*f)(int) = NULL;
    int S::*mp = NULL;
    void(S::*mfp)(int) = NULL;
    auto nullvar = NULL; // may trigger a warning when compiling with gcc/clang
    
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "The type of nullvar is " &lt;&lt; typeid(nullvar).name() &lt;&lt; '\n';
    
    if constexpr(std::is_same_v&lt;decltype(NULL), std::nullptr_t&gt;)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "NULL implemented with type std::nullptr_t\n";
    else
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "NULL implemented using an integral type\n";
    
    [](...){}(p, p2, f, mp, mfp); // &lt; suppresses "unused variable" warnings
}
|p=true
|output=
The type of nullvar is long
NULL implemented using an integral type
}}
